benchmark_details.name: Benchmark for Evaluating Binary Code Understanding Using Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark evaluates the effectiveness of Large Language Models (LLMs) in real-world reverse engineering scenarios, focusing on two key binary code understanding tasks: function name recovery and binary code summarization.
benchmark_details.data_type: decompiled pseudo code, function names, natural language summaries

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of Large Language Models in understanding binary code through function name recovery and binary code summarization tasks.

data.source: Real-world software projects implemented in C language available on GitHub
data.annotation: Automated annotation using ChatGPT for generating summaries

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on token-level comparisons for function names and summary generation evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision and recall indicate better performance in accurately recovering function names and summarizing binary code.
methodology.baseline_results: ChatGPT and various LLMs were used as baselines for evaluation against deep learning-based expert models such as SymLM and BinT5.
methodology.validation: The benchmark dataset was constructed ensuring no data leakage, with systematic correctness checks by domain experts.
